subject: Re: [junit] Unit testing system type failures
msgSnippet: ... It s not easy to provide a sensible stub for the File class since File is only an encapsulation of the file name. You have to write stub streams as well
messageBody:
> 2. Write a mock (or stub) File class that can be setup to simulate system
> failures. This one sounds like too much effort, especially since File is
> not an interface. Also this approach only tests the system style failure
> and not the jvm failure.

It's not easy to provide a sensible stub for the File class since File is
only an encapsulation of the file name. You have to write stub streams as
well which do the real input/output stuff. My suggestion would be to
introduce an interface which covers only your special requirements, e.g.

public interface MyFile {
PrintWriter getWriter();
BufferedReader getReader();
boolean exists();
}

That way you can easily introduce a mock implementation which provides you
with the mock writer and reader instances.

However, it might not be worth the effort.

Johannes
